moves.1. e4: Another game from the Chelyabinsk tournament. Black had difficulties from quite early on as we will see.
moves.6. Ndb5: I have played this now a few times in this tournament and it has served me well
moves.6... d6: Probably the best response. It tries to prevent the b5 knight causing problems
moves.7. Nd5: Again my standard move in this tournament, threatens N c7 which means the black king will lose the right to castle as well as losing his rook
moves.8... Ne7: I'm still not sure what the best move is here, probably Nb8. It seems to me that the move here crowds the king
moves.9. c3: Opens a line for the queen d1-a4. I prefer this to c4 as here I still have f1-a6 for my lsb
moves.9... a6: Black has to be very careful now, this move could lose the rook (or the game) as we will see
moves.10. Qa4: Note here that if white takes the knight he loses his rook. More dangerously I am looking at Nc7#
moves.10... Nxd5: This is where we left the Gameknot database. The move is almost forced due to my mate threat. Black will still lose material
moves.12. Nxd5+: I didn't take the rook as it isn't doing much and my knight is a lot more useful out in the open as it is here
moves.13. Qg4+: Black can't take the knight due to 13 ... KxN 14 Qc4 . At this point I knew black was in big trouble but wasn't sure how to finish him off.
moves.13... f5 14. Qc4: Blacks pieces have limited mobility now, both bishops and both rooks are pretty well confined, If I can maintain momentum things look promising. Both my bishops can easily get into provide reinforcement, and after letting my dsb out I can get my a rook onto the half open d file which could be very useful
moves.15. Qa4+: I decided to force him back and bring my lsb into play
moves.15... Ke6 16. Bc4 b5: I'm not sure this helps black at all
moves.17. Bxb5: Clearly if he takes the bishop he loses a rook
moves.17... Bb7:
I looked at Bd7 which would gain me a rook for a knight with  18 Bd7 , Qxd7 19 Qxd7 , Kxd7, 20 Nb6  forking the rook.

I also looked at Be8 but couldn't see how to turn that into a big advantage.

If I could get his king onto a black square I had a threat of Bg5  gaining the queen
moves.18. Bc6: In the end I went for what is probably the simplest option
moves.20. Nc7+:
At this point black resigned.

Thanks for reading
